Kernels¶

The collection of kernels.

class kernel.Kernel(name: Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

Base class for all kernel functions. By inheriting the Module class from Objax, seamless interaction with model parameters is provided.

static dist(x: jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.array, y: jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.array) → float[source]¶

Compute the squared distance matrix between two inputs.

Args:

x: A 1xN vector y: A 1xM vector

Returns:

A float value quantifying the distance between x and y.

static gram(func: Callable, x: jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray, y: jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray) → jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Compute the kernel’s gram matrix given two, possibly identical, Jax arrays.

Args:

func: The kernel function to be called for any two values in x and y. x: An NxD vector of inputs. y: An MXE vector of inputs.

Returns:

An NxM gram matrix.

class kernel.RBF(lengthscale: jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray = DeviceArray([1.], dtype=float32), variance: jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray = DeviceArray([1.], dtype=float32), name: str = 'RBF')[source]¶

The radial basis function kernel.

feature_map(x: jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray, y: jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray) → jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Compute the RBF specific function

class kernel.Stationary(lengthscale: Optional[jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray] = DeviceArray([1.], dtype=float32), variance: Optional[jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray] = DeviceArray([1.], dtype=float32), name: Optional[str] = 'Stationary')[source]¶

A base class for stationary kernels. That is, kernels whereby the Gram matrix’s values are invariant to the value of the inputs, and instead depend only on the distance between the inputs.
